channel.title: It says 'java' is not recognized as an internal or external command?
channel.description: I have no clue why this happens but when I go to server and i click run.bat it says 'java' is not recognized as an interna or external command,or other times it is the wrong jdk and idk what update i have of jdk. plz help!

item.source: It says 'java' is not recognized as an internal or external command?

item.title: It says 'java' is not recognized as an internal or external command?
item.dc:creator: @usman555 usman555
item.description:
@usman555 wrote:

K so do this:

If you have 32 Bit:

Go to the second box in the Environmental Variables
Click “New”
Put Variable Name: CLASSPATH
Put Variable Value: C:/Program Files/Java/jdk1.6.0_22
Press Ok
Click “New” again
Put Variable Name: PATH
Put Variable Value: C:/Program Files/Java/jdk1.6.0_22
Press Ok
Press Ok
And press the last Ok. Then try running your server.

And if you have 64 Bit do this:

Go to the second box in the Environmental Variables
Click “New”
Put Variable Name: CLASSPATH
Put Variable Value: C:/Program Files (x86)/Java/jdk1.6.0_22
Press Ok
Click “New” again
Put Variable Name: PATH
Put Variable Value: C:/Program Files (x86)/Java/jdk1.6.0_22
Press Ok
Press Ok
And press the last Ok. Then try running your server.

Read full topic
item.source: It says 'java' is not recognized as an internal or external command?

item.dc:creator: @usman555 usman555
item.description:

[quote=“imsuperman05, post:11, topic:403952”]try

@echo off title Server java -Xmx512m -cp bin;deps/poi.jar;deps/mysql.jar;deps/mina.jar;deps/slf4j.jar;deps/slf4j-nop.jar;deps/jython.jar;log4j-1.2.15.jar; server.Server pause[/quote]I don’t think that’d work, I think he didn’t set his paths.
